business.headline: Credit card changes in December: 4 banks revise fees and rewardsBanks like SBI, Axis, Yes Bank, and AU Small Finance Bank are updating credit card fees, rewards, and policies in December 2024, impacting transactions, redemptions, and reward categories.

NPS Vatsalya: Key benefits, investments, and withdrawal rules explained NPS Vatsalya, launched in September, enables guardians to secure a child's financial future with regulated investments, early savings benefits, and partial withdrawal options until age 18.
Swiggy Q2 results: Net loss narrows to Rs 625.5 crore in 1st earnings after IPOSwiggy's revenue from operations rose by 30% year-on-year (YoY) to Rs 3,601 crore, up from Rs 2,763 crore in Q2FY24.
Sensex, Nifty end higher as banking stocks rally; SBI gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 597.67 points to close at 80,845.75, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 181.10 points to end at 24,457.15.

Elon Musk's $56 billion Tesla pay rejected by US court againThe court upheld its earlier ruling from January, which called the compensation plan excessive and rescinded it, despite Tesla shareholders voting in June to reinstate it.

I was as explicit as I could be: Binance CEO on WazirX hackBinance CEO Changpeng Zhao addressed the WazirX hack on X, emphasising Binance's non-involvement, as users seek answers to their frozen funds.
Explained: Why HDFC Bank share price gained 2% today HDFC Bank shares rose 2% in early trade to touch a day high of Rs 1,837. At 1:34 pm, the stock was trading 1.25% higher at Rs 1,827.10.
Housing prices rise 11% across top Indian cities. Is your city on the list?The average housing price across eight major cities now stands at Rs 11,000 per square foot, according to a report.

Sensex soars over 500 points: 3 factors behind stock market rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex rose 562.95 points to reach 80,811.03 at 12:55 pm, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed 152.15 points to 24,425.85. Broader market indices also traded in the green, reflecting widespread optimism across sectors.

Why Ola Electric share price jumped today? 3 factors behind strong rally Ola Electric Stock Price: Over the past five trading sessions, Ola Electric shares have gained nearly 28%, recovering sharply from their 52-week low of Rs 66.60.

Explained: Why Swiggy share price gained in early trade todaySwiggy's share price jumped over 9% to reach a day high of Rs 542.10, marking a 39% gain over its issue price of Rs 390. At 11:07 am, the stock was trading 3.36% higher at Rs 512 on the Bombay Stock Exchange.

UIDAI extends free Aadhaar updates until December 14: All you need to knowUIDAI has extended the free Aadhaar update deadline to December 14, 2024, allowing users to update key details online for free.

Explained: Why ITC, Godfrey Phillips shares fell in early trade today ITC, Godfrey Phillips stocks fell in early trade after a proposed change from the Group of Ministers (GoM) on GST rate rationalisation.

Explained: Why KPIT Technologies share price jumped 6% todayAt 10:28 am, the stock was trading 5.90% higher at Rs 1,420.65 on the Bombay Stock Exchange, regaining some momentum after a period of underperformance.

Wipro shares down 50%? Here's why some apps are showing the wrong priceWipro share price: Wipro stocks appeared down by 50%. However, the decline shown in certain brokerage platforms is not due to a genuine fall in the stock's value.
Sensex, Nifty open flat; ITC share price down 3% The S&P BSE Sensex was up 39.47 points to 80,287.55, while the NSE Nifty50 added 21.05 points to 24,297.10.

Share price of ITC, Godfrey Phillips to be in focus today. Here's why Shares of ITC and Godfrey Phillips, which derive a huge portion of their revenue from the tobacco and cigarette business, are likely to see movement based on investor reactions.

Stocks to watch today: Adani Power, Wipro, Swiggy, Tata Power, CiplaDespite mixed signals, several stocks such as Adani Power, Wipro, Swiggy, Tata Power, Cipla are expected to be in focus today due to key news and developments.

Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger's 'Bittersweet' response after being forced out Intel's Chief Financial Officer, David Zinsner, and Executive Vice President, Michelle Johnston Holthaus, have taken over as interim co-CEOs while the board searches for a permanent replacement.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: South Korea president declares martial law, parliament rejects moveThe South Korean Parliament voted to reject martial law, with Speaker Woo Won Shik declaring that lawmakers "will protect democracy with the people." The resolution was passed with 190 of 300 members in attendance, with all voting in favour.

Military tanks on Seoul streets, protests outside Parliament amid martial lawThousands of people took to the streets, trying to enter the country's Parliament to oppose the imposition of martial law imposed by President Yoon Suk Yeol in an unprecedented televised address.

Devendra Fadnavis meets Eknath Shinde, stage set for Mahayuti oath on ThursdayAfter extensive negotiations within the Mahayuti alliance, Eknath Shinde is likely to take oath as one of two deputy chief ministers at the swearing-in ceremony on December 5, sources said.

Bangladesh summons Indian envoy over breach of its mission in AgartalaBangladesh had lodged a strong protest against the alleged vandalism of its mission in Tripura's Agartala by a group of demonstrators.

Antibiotic breakthrough from India can counter drug-resistant bacteriaIndia has introduced its first indigenous antibiotic, Nafithromycin, targeting drug-resistant pneumonia. The drug is 10 times more efficacious and provides eight times higher lung exposure than azithromycin.

Man indicted for Nepali-origin wife's murder in US, googled when he could remarryA 37-year-old man has been indicted by a Virginia grand jury for the murder of his 28-year-old wife. Naresh Bhatt also faces charges of defiling and concealing the body of Mamta Kafle Bhatt, a nurse. Months after she went missing, Bhatt googled to find out when he could remarry.

Rajasthan couple kill children before hanging themselves, suicide note foundA suicide note, allegedly written by the man, was recovered by the police. He blamed his wife and threats from her family in the note.

Comedian Sunil Pal missing after show, wife files complaint with Mumbai PoliceSunil Pal's wife tried to contact him several times and when she couldn't get in touch with him, she filed a missing person complaint.
Asteroid on collision course with Earth, set to crash tonightThe impact is anticipated around 9:45 pm IST, with a potential variation of five minutes.

What forced Congress to blink on Adani debate?Parliament started functioning on Tuesday, the seventh day, after six days of washout due to Congress protests on the Adani issue. It was massive pressure both within the party and from alliance partners that made the party recalibrate its strategy.

Gurugram woman robbed at gunpoint by BluSmart cab driver, company apologisesThe BluSmart cab driver forced the woman to transfer Rs 55,000 from her mobile phone at gunpoint in Gurugram. He also snatched the woman's bag and mobile phone before fleeing from the spot.

Video: UK chef urges thieves who stole his van with 2,500 pies to donate the lootA British chef, Tommy Banks, urged the thieves who stole his van loaded with 2,500 pies worth £25,000 (approximately Rs 27 lakh) to donate the loot.

Hindus well protected in Bangladesh, better than in Hasina's time: Yunus's aideShafiqul Alam, the press secretary of the Muhammad Yunus government, said an 'industrial scale misinformation campaign' was being run by Indian media to peddle false narratives of minorities being targeted.

UPSC coach Avadh Ojha, now in AAP, once bashed Arvind KejriwalUPSC teacher Avadh Ojha has joined the Aam Admi Party. Ojha, who teaches history by blending it with mythology and current affairs, had tried to get tickets from the BJP, Congress and BSP earlier. Clips of Ojha attacking AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal are being shared now.

Vikrant Massey says not retiring, post misinterpreted: Acting is all I can doActor Vikrant Massey clarified that his recent announcement was not a retirement statement but a break to focus on family and health. He assured fans of his return when the time feels right.

Indian agents meddled in leadership race of Canada Conservatives: Canadian outletRadio-Canada alleged that "Indian agents" interfered in the Conservative Party's leadership race in 2022. The Conservative Party of Canada is the favourite to win the 2025 general election. Those directly involved in the Conservative Party race rejected the claims of interference.

Rashmika Mandanna's The Girlfriend teaser to be shown during Pushpa 2 in theatres Rashmika Mandanna will reprise her role as Srivalli in Pushpa 2: The Rule. During the theatrical release of the film starting December 5, the teaser of Mandanna's upcoming film, The Girlfriend, will be screened.

sports.headline: Who is Sufiyan Muqeem? Pakistan's mystery spinner who scripted history vs ZIMPakistan's young spinner Sufiyan Muqeem etched his name in record books with his record-breaking spell in the 2nd T20I vs Zimbabwe. Here's all you need to know about Pakistan's rising star.

Rohit Sharma pulls off double duty in nets in Adelaide before pink-ball TestIndia captain Rohit Sharma pulled off a double shift in the nets in Adelaide ahead of the pink-ball Test on Tuesday, December 3. The Indian team had a 4-hour net session ahead of the match on Tuesday.

Indian squash legend Raj Manchanda dies at 79 in New DelhiLegendary India squash player Raj Manchanda, the Arjuna Award recipient and winner of six national titles died at the age of 79 in New Delhi.

Sir Don Bradman's 'baggy green' cap gets auctioned for Rs 2.63 crore in SydneyLegendary Australia batter Sir Don Bradman's Baggy Green cap from 1947-48 was auctioned for Rs 2.63 crore in Sydney. The cap was worn by Bradman during his last series in Australia played against India.

Cook amazed by 'classy' Yashasvi Jaiswal sledging Starc in Perth TestYashasvi Jaiswal earned high praise from Alastair Cook for his remarkable 161-run knock in Perth, showcasing grit and audacity at just 22, even sledging Mitchell Starc during India's commanding Border-Gavaskar Trophy opener against Australia.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
